text: At around 1 a.m. EDT on June 24, 2021, Champlain Towers South, a 12-story beachfront condominium building in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida, United States, partially collapsed. 97 people were killed. Eleven more were injured or taken to the hospital. At least 8 people remain missing. No cause for the collapse has been released but several theories were considered including sinkholes, construction defects, terrorism and roof repairs.Miami building collapse: Possible causes explained by area expert ==References== Category:2021 disasters in the United States Category:2020s in Florida Category:Disasters in buildings and structures Category:June 2021 events
title: Surfside condominium building collapse
